website_summaries.verdict: The Moto G4 Plus is an affordable midrange smartphone that gives you solid hardware, a crisp 1080p display, and broad carrier compatibility, but the competition is fierce.
cons: Fingerprint sensor doesn't function as Home button

customer_reviews.title: screen unworkable while charging
customer_reviews.text: When I charge it turbo adaptor or not the screen freezes and presses things I didn't press complete screen lag and glitch whenever I'm charging I paid slot for this don't expect this with a new phone but frankly can't be bothered going through that long and hard return process again! Be warned some off these phones must have faults that's why cheap for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: charles boz

customer_reviews.title: Not really worth it
customer_reviews.text: I've just learned that you can't corners with getting a decent mobile phone , you get what you pay for! I thought buying this was a good deal at a good price but I should of listened to the other reviews about the ghost screening , poor battery life, over heating, and it gets slower each time i use it..I've had it for about 4 months and should never of bothered with getting this. I've now just purchased the latest iPhone8 that's out . Im not sugesting you go to that sort of extreme..lol but if your here looking to save a few quid on a semi decent phone I would save yourself the disappointment
customer_reviews.author: jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Terrible phone.
customer_reviews.text: I chose this phone purely for the standard of camera as I use it to photograph stages of my work. Not only is the camera rubbish especially when using the flash, the phone has the nightmare ghost key feature. At least 3 times a day, during normal usage it will switch, stop, abandon what I'm doing and open up random apps.. it's just happened while I'm typing this! I can't trust this phone to do anything I ask it to therefore I could never recommend to anyone to buy it. I've only had it a month and I hate it too. Gonna get rid as soon as possible. One star as that's the minimum required to leave a review.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Todd

customer_reviews.title: Motorola G4 ghosts
customer_reviews.text: Size good, The idea of the phone was good. but seem to have ghost 👻takes over the phone on all the apps. Calls people, messaging people, apps going into the bin uninstall. I'm assuming it's a Motorola app as it was OK until they did a up date as read up on forums all the Motorola G4 are doing it. No answer to stop it. Constantly rebooting when it will let me . Shame good mobile to start with . Hopefully someone will sort it not happy with it. I gave Motorola 3 to my husband no problem with that he got same apps on..
customer_reviews.author: Mrs J Moroz

customer_reviews.title: Extremely unreliable and laced with problems
customer_reviews.text: I got this phone in January 2017 and it's been deteriorating rapidly since. First to go was the capability fast charge, followed by battery and charging issues in general. The phone has been getting steadily slower throughout as well - some apps are now almost unusable. There are also other reviews attesting to "ghost fingers" pressing buttons on the screen, which I have also experienced. Today, the phone has finally packed it in and is refusing to turn on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Superior quality for a budget price! Fantastic value!
customer_reviews.text: What a fantastic phone. I cannot believe how reasonably priced this phone is, considering the high specs that this phone boasts. I was a bit hesitant as some of the (very few!) negative reviews mentioned that there was an issue with "ghost touch", i.e. the phone randomly running apps, etc whilst charging. But I have had no issues at all. It is unbelievable value for money and seriously competes with much more expensive phones. It boasts a 16mp rear camera, 5mp front camera, fast processing speed, fast charging speed, good battery life, no bloatware, beautifully clear display, good quality music player, etc. I don't know any other phone that contains all of these features for under £200. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Superb for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a superb phone for the price. Its fast and responsive which means apps are a pleasure to use. The large screen looks good making it ideal for watching videos or viewing photos. The fingerprint sensor works really well giving the phone that added security dimension that more premium phones on the market offer. On the whole, the phone contains many of the more important features needed for a smart phone with the exception of one or two. The only thing that I think it lacks is NFC, which means you cannot use the phone for Android pay when out and about shopping. This is a fairly minor thing IMHO and does not warranty any mark down in scores.
customer_reviews.author: J. East

customer_reviews.title: Great phone. Punches way above its weight
customer_reviews.text: Seriously brilliant phone. Smashed my galaxy s6 plus edge by accident and bought this as a cheap replacement expecting nothing more than that. To say it far exceeds the galaxy in all respects except the screen colour vibrance is true. Now that I am getting used to a marginally less colour brilliance I wouldn't swap the Moto for the galaxy unless I was bribed. Fast, light,clear sound. Responsive and tough. Charges to full very very quickly and lasts plus I can add memory myself. Brilliant camera and only now am i realising how useless the galaxys edge functions were. Very pleased as I need the phone for business not a fashion accessory and the Moto is exactly that. Great buy
customer_reviews.author: Mr. John Graham

customer_reviews.title: Ok for awhile, lenovo horrible support AVOID!
customer_reviews.text: Great at first then died after a year for no reason and Lenovo support refused to fix and then held ransom to pay in order to get the faulty product Back! Thankfully amazon were very helpful after this but Lenovos support was disgusting to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: Tb

customer_reviews.title: GR8 value smartphone shame about intermittent flicker/ghost screen glitch!
customer_reviews.text: Apart from the intermittent flicker/ghost screen glitch I've found the Moto g4 plus great value. Call quality is fine and the large screen is easy to navigate. Particularly like the 16mp camera and photos turn out nice and sharp.16gb internal storage is adequate with an option to add an SD card. Fast turbo charge is pretty good and battery life reasonable when turning on the battery saver facility.On the Motorola site it recommends the device is turned off/on again to clear the glitch but it is only a temporary measure. Hopefully a software update may be rolled out at sometime.Would have given 5 stars but taken one off for the ghost screen glitch.
customer_reviews.author: gary

customer_reviews.title: Moto G4 PLUS updated
customer_reviews.text: This is the Moto G4Plus Model XT1642 16gb ROM , 2gb RAM ,Dual 4g micro sim in White, its running on Marshmallow 6.0.1, Only had a couple of days but seems to be a great Value Moby ,Cool smooth running Android system , quite a handful 6" x 3" body with a 5.5" screen ,But my old moby was Xperia z2 5" Motorola feels lighter better in the hand with clearer screen. Update 10/12/2016 The more i use it it's a Great phone, No Heat at all with normal use , Camera is Excellent, Recommend with no hesitation UPDATE 07/08/2018 Screen has died, BUT it has been a great moby so have ordered the same model again
customer_reviews.author: Jonboy

customer_reviews.title: Great phone at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Been using my 16gb Moto G4 Plus for a few months now after replacing my broken LG G3 and not wanting to enter another 24 month contract. I wasnt expecting the greatest smartphone out there, but what Motorola have delivered has exceeded my expectations. Its a good looking, more than capable, everyday phone with a few gimmicks (Fingerprint screen lock). Its not frozen or crashed, its been dropped a few times and has come out unscathed and the voice clarity on calls is excellent. It can struggle if you have multipul apps running at once, it 'chugs' a bit, but its nothing to frustrating. All in all, I expect my next phone will be the Moto G5 plus :-)
customer_reviews.author: kieran howard

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect (almost)
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as replacement for an earlier model Moto G that was lost. Good speed and screen and has the essential feature for me of dual Sim slot. Only two major criticisms considering how good the earlier model was are that they have removed the notification LED which to me is a very useful feature, and the touchscreen suffers from a strange fault that results in ghost presses if you try to use phone while it is charging - not the end of the world but still a nuisance.
customer_reviews.author: GK

customer_reviews.title: Best phone I've ever had by far.
customer_reviews.text: I was very sceptical that a £200 phone could live up to my requirements but it's exceeded them. Forget the specs, this phone is so user friendly. I tried the top dog phone samsung galaxy s7 edge and it's awful to use, way too sensitive. This phone just works brilliantly in every way. I love you wrist flick to get camera. The keyboard is so nice to use. Everything is initiative ahh at last a phone that I can love again. Very light in the hand too, and so far I've had no overheating issues at all. No headphones in the package though but you do get a turbo charger usb.
customer_reviews.author: s herbert

customer_reviews.title: Avoid the Moto G4 and go for the Moto G4 Play
customer_reviews.text: This is now the second time that I purchased the larger 5.5" Moto G4 and had to send it back within three weeks because the software started going haywire. There seems to be a fundamental problem with this model. However I have not had the same issue with the smaller 5" Moto G Play, which I recommend over and above this model.
customer_reviews.author: A. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: I was going to do a pro and con,but as yet there are no cons..
customer_reviews.text: Using Two SIMS at the same time. One with Giffgaff,the other with Asda Mobile. You can receive/send calls and text from both accounts. When receiving a call it will say incoming via Giffgaff or incoming via EE Probably would say the same for other network providers. No unwanted pre-installed software. Good signal strength on both Giffgaff and EE. Sound quality is very good. Camera is very good Be aware the first day.If you do the updates it will chew on your battery, after that its fine. I bought this cover for the phone.Its very good
customer_reviews.author: Des

customer_reviews.title: Good phone
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone for my mother and she is happy with it as it has good screen size and feel light when holding it. The screen brightness and colors are good. The only thing disappointed me is no headphone included and back plastic cover is not easy to remove but a guidance note is helpful for this. Good phone in this price range. The phone camera takes nice pics in day and quality is not that bad for 8MP camera.
customer_reviews.author: pragnesh

customer_reviews.title: Returned for a refund within a week
customer_reviews.text: Bought this just a week ago (ironically based on positive reviews) and now returning to amazon for a refund. From day 1 there were problems with phantom touches where the phone would suddenly develop a mind of its own and go crazy activating button presses, opening apps, etc, without any user input, eventually freezing and requiring a 'hard' reset to fix. This happened multiple times a day at random times rendering the phone unreliable and basically useless. Tried phoning amazon support who suggested doing a factory reset which didn't solve the issue. Perhaps I was just unlucky with a bad unit, but I'm afraid, based on my experience, I cannot recommend this phone.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it
customer_reviews.text: Don't but it! 1) Mobile died while using it. Unable to charge. Mobile broken during warranty period 2) Poor Lenovo service. 3) As I am travelling, I tried to find local service center from its website. Non of addresses provided on website are correct, non of contact numbers are reachable 4) Call number from Moto website. got new list of service centers, even from this list numbers are not reachable 5) Went to service center Pune India, there is big queue, service employees are not helpful either. Shocked with rude behavior Conclusion : Don't buy any phone from Lenovo, Service is very poor.
customer_reviews.author: PragmaticBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing phone.
customer_reviews.text: Loved this phone. It has finally died and the G7 is out today, so I'm upgrading to the G7 Power. This thing really held up though. Became sluggish towards the end of it's life, and I had to replace the power buttons twice, but aside from that this was a gem in the Moto G series. It was on offer recently for £99 and if you're looing at reviews because you want a bargain or a back-up phone, say for work, would recommend this. I've had some awful budget phones before (Moto E3 is so slow it is unuseable) but the G4 plus is a genuine diamond.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Warm

customer_reviews.title: great phones
customer_reviews.text: bought this as gift for my mum n she loves it ...then my dad whos old fashioned n always has had hand ne down phones always the bore ohhh i don't get technology everyones addicted n i thought about time he sees the benefit of a good phone well hes a phone whizz n its never out of his hands he loves it ....great phones great price
customer_reviews.author: susan l.

customer_reviews.title: One of the better phones I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: Other then GoogleKeyboard being stupid, the phone itself is fantastic, I cannot believe the amount of tech you get for such little money. I'm hugely picky about phones, they drive me insane , but this one is slick. The camera has lovely results, its not good in low light situations if you don't use the flash though.
customer_reviews.author: GTS

customer_reviews.title: A great phone for everyday use
customer_reviews.text: This phone works well straight out of the box. The Moto G4 use of native Android means all the apps work as I would expect and means that upgrading from an earlier version of a similar phone has been very easy, with everything working in the same way. The speed of the processor and the space provided by the 16GB phone makes it very user friendly without the hazards of "No more space" or crashes which I had experienced in an older less powerful phone. I would recommend the phone to anyone and at this price it is an amazingly good offer.
customer_reviews.author: Haydn

customer_reviews.title: Nope- glitches.
customer_reviews.text: This seemed like a good budget phone to help me transfer from Windows Phone. Within days the screen started to flutter, and act all on it's own. Opening apps, typing random letters and beyond control. Tried clean fresh start, factory start, removing practically all apps. Changed launcher. nothing cured it. Seems, according to other reviews, it's pot luck whether you get a duff one. Credit to Amazon, they refunded without question or delay. Chanced a moto G5 plus S and it's spectacular. No glitches. works fine. Long battery.
customer_reviews.author: Hazlitt

customer_reviews.title: To cut a long story short a fantastic Smart Phone for the money
customer_reviews.text: To cut a long story short a fantastic Smart Phone for the money...it doesn't have NFC support so unable to use Google Pay..however does everything an overpriced competitor device does and does it just as good in most cases... The CPU offers blistering performance which even beats the latest iterations of 'common' brands.. the display is sharp and offers 1080p resolution which is more than enough for a hand held device..not being interested with the 4k marketing gimmicks given that you'll only ever notice on an 80" display😂 All in all a superb device for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Waz H

customer_reviews.title: Great phone - can't get better for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great phone - can't get better for the price. A big improvement on Moto G 1st edition which was my previous phone. I'm not a big mobile user as I work from home so use a landline and don't want or need a high-spec mobile. (My home reception is awful so I actually have no choice - my phone company is Virgin!). Being able to install an extra memory card has made this so much better as my last phone was creaking at the seams and was totally full. Phone will soon also run Nougat - so what more is there to ask.
customer_reviews.author: Benaron

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: This phone worked great for the first few months until I started experiencing some ghost touching, making my phone useless at times because I couldn't scroll or click anything. And then it got progressively worse. Many people seem to be experiencing this, so it's a problem on their end. Motorola Support told me to send it in for repair but that they would be charging a fee for a problem that's clearly a problem with manufacturing . They couldn't even tell me how much the repair would cost. Needless to say, I'm furious.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Quality Smartphone & At A Great  Price!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow!! Absolutely Delighted So Far With This Smartphone!! Really Well Made,Excellent Build Quality,Excellent Feature's & Look's Very Stylish In The White Colour!! Hadn't A Clue What Smartphone To Go For After My LG G3 Completely Died On Me (The Worst Smartphone I've EVER Owned - Full Of Stupid Faults) & It Was My Best Friend & Her Husband That Highly Recommend This Phone To Me!! & They Both Where 100% Right,As I Honestly Haven't Looked Back!! Thankyou Also Amazon For All The Help You Gave Me With This Purchase!! Xx
customer_reviews.author: P Stewart

customer_reviews.title: great value for money
customer_reviews.text: good so far. some slight glitches early on (and why its only 4 stars) but I don't know if this is issue with the apps, the os or the phone itself. camera is great, and the phone can handle all the apps i regularly use without much issue. it warms up something rotten with a few but then so did my old iPhone. For the price, this is exactly what I want and need.
customer_reviews.author: Braz

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Phone - Highly Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: A truly fantastic phone, perfect for either first timers or experienced smartphone users! The display is crisp, sharp and suitably large for watching videos with comfort. That said, the phone remains easy to operate with one hand, and fits into trouser pockets with no problems, so you get the best of both worlds. As for functionality, you get all of the usual Android capabilities, coupled with an excellent camera and quick processor. The phone never seems to lag; calls are also crystal clear. I absolutely cannot fault the G4 Plus, and would highly recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last for long before it begins to deteriorate.
customer_reviews.text: I have this phone just over a year and it has been a constant battle just to do the simplest of things. The battery life was fine at first... but gradually degraded over time to where I would be lucky to get 4 hours of use before it would die. 50 percent of the time it suffers from ghost touching glitch, which makes for a very unpleasant experience, the phone is unusable when this glitch happens. Very dissatisfied with how the phone has deteriorated over time.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Reilly

customer_reviews.title: A well built android phone with many useful features. Overall impressed with it
customer_reviews.text: A well built android phone with many useful features. Overall impressed with it. Although, it online assistance from the global company is required, then I am afraid not very helpful. It is best to contact UK HQ in Basingstoke where technical help is far better with helpful staff there.
customer_reviews.author: Peymang

customer_reviews.title: Great full featured phone for budget price... kitten proof!
customer_reviews.text: Its actually really good for the money, my daughters 13th phone, and she breaks phones like king kong gets through bananas, six months in and its still good and she is on every form of media 24/7, so music, video, email, screen are all good, pity you don't get a good headset but apart from that its great and she hasn't killed the battery yet. Fully featured Android phone, with good phone technology, its is big to buy a good case with it or the new version
customer_reviews.author: Runswick

customer_reviews.title: Great value for money
customer_reviews.text: Very good smart phone have been using it for 3 years never got a problem. But it is old now giving me some problems as all of sudden turns off. Long lasting battery covered all its weak points compared to named Samsung and I phones of which I had bad experiences regarding battery. Camera results and strong quality of screen are perfect to me being everyday user.
customer_reviews.author: buyer

customer_reviews.title: Great value smartphone!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great value smartphone, which was delivered in a timely fashion, well-packaged, and so far works perfectly. For the price compared with the i-phones and Samsungs, there is nothing to fault. Very intuitive to use and functions very smoothly. It certainly does what it says on the tin and for a very reasonable price!
customer_reviews.author: Mel Anthony

customer_reviews.title: This is a fantastic phone. In the past I've always bought 'high ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic phone. In the past I've always bought 'high end', however I just got fed up with worrying about it getting damaged or when it would develop a fault. The G4 does basically everything my last £400 Android phone does, or least everything I need it to do. Fast, stable, good camera, nice screen. There's nothing to complain about. Personally I think the bubble is going to burst with the top end phones once people start realizing there really isn't a reason to pay more.
customer_reviews.author: Amarendra Singh

customer_reviews.title: Trouble trouble trouble, more trouble than its worth. Constantly judders, freezes, opens and closes apps on its own accord.
customer_reviews.text: If I could send this back, I would. Suffers from so-called 'ghost touching'. Trouble trouble trouble, more trouble than its worth. Constantly judders, freezes, opens and closes apps on its own accord. Switches itself off, in the middle of texting, flips madly through different screens... and you can't take the battery out! Avoid this like the plague!
customer_reviews.author: Broomfield65

customer_reviews.title: Best phone for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent phone for the money. Octacore, 2GB ram, 16GB storage which is expandable. I have added a 64GB Samsung micro SD and set to use as internal storage. Update: I have had this phone for over 2 years and has been fault free until now. The battery is failing. Other than that I have been very happy with this phone. I might just replace the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Lee L.

customer_reviews.title: Struck down by the "Ghost touch"
customer_reviews.text: I was a huge fan of Moto G's. I was telling everyone they should buy one. And they are great apart from this Ghost touch issue which started when the phone was less than a year old and got progressively worse. The phone eventually became totally unreliable. It might be OK or it might be possessed by this evil spirit! Amazon were excellent however and offered a refund despite the phone being 16 months old. It has however dented my confidence in Moto G post lenovo so I'm going to give the LG G4 H818P DUAL SIM a go.
customer_reviews.author: EssentialSkillz

customer_reviews.title: Great value for money
customer_reviews.text: A 5 out of 5. Great value for money. Add in a £5 16Gb memory card, and you have a fantastic, low cost mobile.
customer_reviews.author: Mr M

customer_reviews.title: All in all one of my better decisions in buying the Moto G4 Plus
customer_reviews.text: I previously had a Moto 3 but wanted more memory, a larger screen and because of rather indifferent rural coverage - dual sims. All have been very useful in comparison with the Moto 3's capability. The fast charge is superb and the fingerprint logon excellent and so too is the screen definition. Finally, the camera so far seems to be much better the the Moto 3 and worth the extra money. I would assess this phone to be more than adequate for the majority of folk, especially those who are fed up of being ripped off by the more fruity competitors.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen North Yorkshire

customer_reviews.title: Same fault twice
customer_reviews.text: I have now returned my second moto g4 as the same fault happened again. It's a common fault with these phones where the screen has a mind of its own and starts playing up, known as ghost touching I think. It's a shame as they are really good phones but just must be fitted with bad digitizers.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Decent phone, good value
customer_reviews.text: Generally I am quite happy with it. Based on its processor you may have expected it to be as responsive as other more expensive models, unfortunately if you are used to better and more expensive android phones you would find it lacking quite a bit. Very good value for money though and durable, if you budget doesn't go much higher than this I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Arnak

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant smartphone in a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant smartphone in a reasonable price. Very happy with the purchase. Big screen and easy to use. It's very fast and good looking phone. I have used galaxy s3 for 2 years and it's better than Samsung. Can't find anything wrong with this phone. Would recommend to everyone who is looking for a reasonable price smartphone.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Bal

customer_reviews.title: Constantly glitches.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone 11 months ago. I had to have the first one replaced due to it turning apps offand on that it could not be used. The replacement was good for about 7 months, but the same problem started happening again on occasion. Now, it happens constantly. I definitely do not recommend this product, unless you want a phone only for a short time before you have to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Whitehead

customer_reviews.title: Great value phone
customer_reviews.text: Great value phone. Feels solid, runs smoothly and takes nice photos. Fingerprint sensor works accurately and quickly. Doesn't have NFC but then that's not something I'm interested in so easy choice over the more expensive G5. Also, this plus model will be eligible for the next Android system update whereas the non-plus model will not. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: loopylysa

customer_reviews.title: brilliant phone so far and does everything an Apple or ...
customer_reviews.text: brilliant phone so far and does everything an Apple or Samsung does but for less than half the price - fast , great picture quality and great sound - cant fault the phone so far and not too much bloatware on it like with other phones - I'm a convert and the other positive reviews were correct - phone is excellent - well done MOTO...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Deterioration after 10 months.
customer_reviews.text: This phone was great untill about the 10th month where it's been having problems picking up WIFI signal and staying connected, this is only getting worse. Now into the 11th month the phone keeps freezing, not letting apps run properly and shutting them down. Very annoying to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: S. Coles

customer_reviews.title: No compass. No magnetic sensor means Google Maps is broken means not a proper smartphone.  Avoid.
customer_reviews.text: Google Maps, aeroplane trackers, astronomy and navigation apps, GPS games like Pokemon Go and Ingress. None of these work at all or as expected on this phone. This phone can not tell you the direction you are facing. Everything else is perfect, web pages load fast and look good. But get something with all the usual sensors. GPS seems to get position fast, but without the compass it takes longer to work out where you are going.
customer_reviews.author: Alchitecht

customer_reviews.title: I am really disappointed!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone less than a month ago. first, when the package arrived, the box was open and beaten. second, hours after starting to use the phone began to go crazy, worked alone, the flashlight was turned on and off and it was impossible to turn off the mobile.now I have returned the phone, requesting that I get the money back. the company only tells me that the mobile works correctly and that I have to pay for having reviewed the phone. I am very disappointed because nobody gives me a solution.
customer_reviews.author: Cliente Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Bad Phone or just Unlucky ?
customer_reviews.text: Phone arrived with distorting speaker, it was then returned to Amazon authorized repair centre in Co.Antrim. Four months later the operating system became unstable and continually produces request for PUK sim unlock code. Second return now in progress. Meanwhile I have had to purchase replacement phone as I am disabled and rely on my phone for daily business.
customer_reviews.author: The Evaluator

customer_reviews.title: It's such a good product reasonably priced and I am still currently using ...
customer_reviews.text: It's such a good product reasonably priced and I am still currently using it now I love the hole twist for the camera and shake for the torch software and updates are frequent camera is very decent storage is great add an SD card slot inside pretty good enjoy it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I was excited about this 4th Generation Motorola, after having the 3rd Gen with no complaint. The specs added up to a rather fantastic sounding phone. The reality however was rather different this time. I am in the process of sending the phone back for a refund. From the beginning j have struggled with the power button. It more often than not does not work, or else lags for up to 15 secs. With no fix available. Ruling that out I have experienced problems with the phone when handling calls. The camera is amazing and the rest of the phone works so well. It's just a real shame about the faults that leave it unusable as a phone!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Incredible value
customer_reviews.text: After about 2 weeks of using this phone, I 100% recommend it. The battery charges in no time at all and will last all day with moderate to heavy use (So far I charge it roughly every 36hours). Took a bit of getting used to switching from apple to android but that only took a day or so. The lack of notification badges for apps (The little red circle with a number in it on apple devices) is the only thing I miss, and I know there are apps which allow you to add this which I will endeavour to do soon. The extra £400-500 for an iPhone no longer seems worth it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money Only thing I noticed ed ...
customer_reviews.text: Have been using it for two weeks No major concerns yet. Good value for the money Only thing I noticed ed is that the battery cover doesn't fit pefectly. There is a small gap near to the USB charging port. I use a phone cover so it's not annoying anymore but it was a slightly dissappontment. There no head phone but I don't really care about it No magnet but not sure how many ppl uses that Two days of battery life with a moderate use Overall very good phone
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not cheap and not great
customer_reviews.text: After 5 months starting to have lots of problems with this phone. The storage is too small phone is constantly running out of space you can't move apps onto your memory card. Sometimes when my phone it charging it becomes unusable buttons start to press by themselves and the phone just starts flickering and switch from one application to the next and burn marks have started to appear on my screen. Overall I wouldnt recommend this phone, it does the basics well but I could have got a better phone for half the price and it would probably last me just as long if not longer if this phone last me a year I'll be very suprised.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value phone
customer_reviews.text: Great value for money phone, good size screen, dual sim works very well. I had a few initial problems but now I understand the phone and the android system the early niggles have gone away. This phone has converted me a iPhone user from the start to an android user. This is a great phone at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Wagstaff

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone, great price
customer_reviews.text: This is my first smartphone and I am very happy with it. It's easy to use, responds quickly, loads all the apps I wanted to use. The camera is really good!
customer_reviews.author: Dormouse

customer_reviews.title: Display flickering randomly
customer_reviews.text: The display starts flickering randomly, notifications starts scrolling up and down. Home and back Button are seems to operative at same time and rapidly. Only way to stop it is by turning the phone off. I had the phone replaced but didn't resolve the problem, appears to be a software issue. Poor support from Amazon with them only replacing the phone, then issuing a refund and stating it would be removed from sale but that never happened.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Moto G4 white dual sim version
customer_reviews.text: Very very very happy with the phone. Sharp and large screen, superb camera, more than enough memory & storage with expandable sd card. Excellent speaker loud and clear. Clean system. And with the ability to use dual sim its a must have for me. I've used many dual sim phones but only this one supports simultaneously 3G on both sim cards. Especially for people like me who needs to put a three sim card in the second slot. Must say thank you Motorola for releasing a such brilliant phone at such low cost and well done Amazon for the super fast delivery service.
customer_reviews.author: e.e

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Had Samsung, had Apple, BUY THIS instead. Save £250. Treat the kids, grand-kids, homeless......
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Malfunction with my Motorolla
customer_reviews.text: Very useful functions and satisfactory price. It has a very serious malfunction. Every now and then (especially while charging) the shortcuts on the screen start moving randomly which make it impossible to use and during this strange behavior some shortcuts are deleted
customer_reviews.author: Theo Micha

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Love this phone, didn't want to pay ridiculous amounts for a new one and liked to stay on android because well you know.. It's the best. Thus phone is exactly like my old Samsung one, so taking this risk payed off! Plus it arrived so quickly and was half charged so I just needed to put my sim and memory card in and I was away!
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Gets plenty of good reviews. The only reason I have not given ...
customer_reviews.text: My first smartphone, so it's taking a bit of getting used to. But it came well within the delivery estimate, and it's a decent phone, with lots of features. Gets plenty of good reviews. The only reason I have not given 5 stars is, I wanted to put some of the astronomy type apps that I have on my tablet, on it. But it either doesn't have an accelerometer, or a compass, I can't remember which was reported by Sky Map. So you can't 'point' to a particular area of sky, to see what astral phenomena are currently visible. You have to 'drag' the display, which is not ideal.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip

customer_reviews.title: Ghost button presses after 10 months :(
customer_reviews.text: So 10 months in and my Moto G4 Plus has developed ghost button presses and then it just goes mad starting apps and doing unwanted things, interestingly (or not) is that my daugther's Moto G4 dual sim phone has also developed the same problem. So I'm now about to see how good Amazon and Motorola are resolving these issues. Up until these problems they were great phones, but I cannot rely upon it now, and will go elsewhere next time.
customer_reviews.author: RO1

customer_reviews.title: Overall a good deal
customer_reviews.text: I have used it for about one month. It is working properly, battery lasts long (more than a day, even playing music and having a couple of video call on WhatsApp)) an charges very quickly. It felt from my hand straight in a pond and nothing happened (note that I have a cover and screen protection). As negative sides, it is VERY big which can be a bit awkward at the beginning. The camera is not really that impressive and I find it hard to take steady pictures of small objects. Works fine with portraits and videos.
customer_reviews.author: Sofia Croci

customer_reviews.title: the charges are fakely written
customer_reviews.text: i had 100 pounds on my amazon account and the total charges for the order was supposed to be 82.50 pounds + 24.65 pounds making it 107. 15 pounds. Then i added my card, they charged the 100 pounds i have on my amazon account and also charge money worth of 50 pounds from my card. it's hopeless and horrible!!!though, delivery was very fast
customer_reviews.author: smart jay

customer_reviews.title: Wont recognise sim.. so whats the point of having it as a phone?!?
customer_reviews.text: had this for just over 10 days. worked fine, not the best android I have used but hey its cheap, now wont recognise sim card (vodafone UK), tried resetting it to factory, turning it on and off, and even had two brand new sims put in. nothing. zilch, nada. i wouldnt bother with this phone, was sceptical in the first place, first and last budget smart phone I am going to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: A good phone! It is a bit heavy and occasionally ...
customer_reviews.text: A good phone! It is a bit heavy and occasionally slow, and the memory is quite small. However it does what I wanted it for, a simple, easy phone that doesn't break when I drop it and is cheap!
customer_reviews.author: JRushworth

customer_reviews.title: What a Mobile Phone
customer_reviews.text: What can i say....Fantastic mobile, Motorola are the best mobile phones on the market, i sold my previous Moto G when i got a company mobile phone which was a Samsung edge 6 which would cost 3X more Functions The finger print security works fantastic No bloatware Smooth screen touch responsive and fast Fantastic Motrola support This mobile phone has to be the best on the market for a third of the price on competitors mobiles I can assure anyone reading this review will find any mobile phone any better out there
customer_reviews.author: Taff Bala

customer_reviews.title: The phone is very good, very nice display
customer_reviews.text: The phone is very good, very nice display, very quick, and I like the size, fingerprint scanner is very good and very quick and the build quality. However the camera is not 'Best-In-Class', almost all photos come out blurry and HDR is not as good as other phones. I bought this after having a Nexus 5X and it's camera was amazing, it is more expensive but not by much, but by the G4's hype about the camera, I was disappointed with both front and rear camera quality. Other than the camera, a excellent phone. Highly recommend, however unless you want the fingerprint scanner (I did) then just buy the Moto G4 and save a bit of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You're much better off buys a second hand/refurbished Samsung Galaxy S7 which ...
customer_reviews.text: Junk. You're much better off buys a second hand/refurbished Samsung Galaxy S7 which is the same price at the time of writing. After a couple of months of owning the phone randomly started switching off then turning back on the almost no battery life. This intermittent fault continues till now. The camera is very average and slow to load up. The storage capacity sounds a lot but I have yet to be able to save photos onto the SD card so the inbuilt memory quickly fills. And both of the side buttons have fallen off in the last couple of weeks! Don't buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... with the Motorola G4 Plus and certainly haven't been disappointed especially with the price compared to buying a high ...
customer_reviews.text: After reading a lot of the reviews with the positives certainly out weighing the negatives and after a lot of deliberation plumped to go with the Motorola G4 Plus and certainly haven't been disappointed especially with the price compared to buying a high end phone. Another positive for me is the finger print scanner as added security. Would certainly buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Badger60

customer_reviews.title: very nice
customer_reviews.text: Love this phone, some people complain about random loss of contacts,,,,, this is due to linking to other social media sites, this is unnecessary and should be turned off.(sorted). The one facility which is really missed is compass direction which this has none.
customer_reviews.author: alan, Cheshire

customer_reviews.title: Ghost touch - Stay away.
customer_reviews.text: What can I say. Probably going to send it back. 2nd SIM slot doesn't seem to work, but worst of all it has nasty ghost touch. Screen shaking and typing on it's own. Read the reviews online and it seems to be a common problem with this phone. Gutted.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Atkin

customer_reviews.title: Motorola Moto G4 Plus 16GB SIM-Free Smartphone - Black (Single SIM) - (Exclusive to Amazon)
customer_reviews.text: i ordered from germany and got the phone in only 2 days, which was really super fast! all in all i am really satisfied with the phone, it's got everything i need: good cam, touch sensor works almost everytime, quick apps and games, last but not least the price is right (actually i was thinking about to buy an OnePlus Three, but didn't want to spend at least about €400).
customer_reviews.author: hopp schwitz

customer_reviews.title: Quality First
customer_reviews.text: Photos are a bit dark but can change in inbuilt program. Battery life is typical so not great and can get a bit warm when running a lot of apps. Saying all that this is a very good mobile and nice easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: The Searcher

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a budget phone for personal and work use and this is perfect for me. I have been using it for a few weeks now and it has worked great with it's large screen being very easy to read. Very please with the functionality of this phone for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good but starting to get issues
customer_reviews.text: This is a good phone. Starting to get some lag issues and camera issues, but I suspect a reset will correct this. A few random switch offs keep happening as well. Im hopeful that it will sort itself out! It's lasted longer than my past few phones anyway!!
customer_reviews.author: Plebhead

customer_reviews.title: Broken phone
customer_reviews.text: I bought th Motorola Moto G4 SIM free smartphone on 15 Feb 2019 , order number . 205-31166478973130 and it stopped working on 13/12/19 I had to order another phone which was delivered on Saturday 15/12/19 , surely the phone I bought in February should last more than 10 months , I have got another one from yourselves on Saturday , I must be owed some sort of refund . Please help , Mark Moran
customer_reviews.author: Mark Moran

customer_reviews.title: Bought new phone to have something reliable when baby arrived ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought new phone to have something reliable when baby arrived. When on phone it often cuts off where they can't hear me or I can't hear them. I've researched and this is a common problem with this phone. Everything else on phone works perfectly, just not the actual phone bit!
customer_reviews.author: Rosie Broome

customer_reviews.title: Great budget smartphone
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to replace my ageing Blackberry. I went on a couple of phone review sites. This phone was named best budget smartphone of 2016 on a couple. I can get far more apps now. It was so easy to change phones. Just saved my contacts to my SIM and put the SIM in my new phone. Changed a couple of apps like fb and bbm over and I was ready to go. The only criticism is that it is complicated to set a song as a ringtone. Invest in a turbo charger if you buy this phone as the supplied one takes hours to charge.
customer_reviews.author: Mat

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed. Avoid this phone if you can
customer_reviews.text: Ghost touch issue, i only purchased this phone In march 2017. The phone already so many problem, mainly ghost touch and key pad stuck on one number so i cannot even use the phone at all. So disappointed. Avoid this phone if you can !!!!!!. cannot believe I had to sent my phone at my own cost and go without my phone until repair . shocking and very angry customer !!
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Decent phone for SIM only use.
customer_reviews.text: Dual SIM suggested, not provided in this model. Storage can be upgraded, but basic provision is limited. Great facilities for price. Charger cable a little short to work on phone when plugged on
customer_reviews.author: "yabadoo"

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy - Known Issue
customer_reviews.text: There are appear to be quite a large number of known issues with this phone, but perhaps most disturbingly, after ~2 months, it has stopped being able to read SIM's, I've tried a brand new one, and my existing sim, both of which read perfectly well in other phones... I'd avoid it like the plague.
customer_reviews.author: P Ward

customer_reviews.title: Good phone for the money
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Good camera, solid build, seems to run games good. I heard there are over heating issues in regards to using the camera. I run the camera for just over 20 minutes with my cover on and in a warm car, it got slightly warm but not hot. Nice all round phone for the money. If I have any issues I will update the review
customer_reviews.author: jonesy40

customer_reviews.title: Love this Moto G4 plus
customer_reviews.text: My second Moto g. First being the moto g3. Love this Moto G4 plus. The biggest plus is turbo charge- absolutely brilliant how fast it charges. The camera is fine and the finger print reader is somethings hit and miss, but it's worth the extra cost for turbo charge. Pure Android is great combined with nova launcher.
customer_reviews.author: M McSweeney

customer_reviews.title: Touch screen 'ghosts' all the time
customer_reviews.text: The phone touch screen self activates several times a day. Sometimes up to 20 times a day. Basically apps just open by themselves, icons move around the screen and delete themselves. I think I have read somewhere that it is called ghosting. I am able to lessen the behaivior slightly by lowering the brightness, however it still happens, especially if the brightness goes up again. Very disappointed in this phone.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: I love my phone
customer_reviews.text: It might not be an S7 or the like, but it has almost equal use and tech. Excellent camera and easy to use, which is important to me. I get decent battery life, and no worse than the S7 (for instance) which my son has to charge daily, sometimes twice. Costs less for the same job, which I love.
customer_reviews.author: Magenta

customer_reviews.title: The phone itself is very good value for money and I had no issues with ...
customer_reviews.text: I used to be a fan of the Moto G series but unfortunately more recent models do not seem to be built to last. After owning both the moto G3 and Moto G4 Plus, neither phone had a lifespan of over 18 months leading me to believe their budget status means they are not built to last, unlike my mothers original Moto G which has outlived all my more modern ones. The phone itself is very good value for money and I had no issues with it (other than ghost typing) for almost a full year.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: A good phone while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the G4 plus on 12th Dec 2016 and it's been a great phone up until now where things have started to go tits up with it. A year and a half ish it's lasted me before it's become unbearable. The biggest issue I've had and seems to be a common problem is it turns itself off randomly and also fails to detect SD card. Motorola seem to have turned a blind eye to fixing this, tons of people having the same issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Switched and no regrets.
customer_reviews.text: I've switched from an iPhone 6 plus and have no regrets. As the quote goes " it does everything it says on the box.
customer_reviews.author: robert duncan

customer_reviews.title: as for the phone absolutely love it but then again I am easy to please
customer_reviews.text: Have had the phone over a month now after returning the first due to a problem with sound only coming out of 1 ear piece, only after receiving replacement when doing a factory reset and rechecking I noticed the fault was rectified, seemed to be a common fault if this happens maybe worth executing this action before returning phone and avoid the inconvenience for both you as the consumer and supplier cost, as for the phone absolutely love it but then again I am easy to please.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Value for Money
customer_reviews.text: I purchased G4 and you will fall in love with this as soon as you recieve it Pros Build quality Screen Tocuh Feed back Vanilla Android Promised Android updates Cons No NFC No Compass No Finger print scanner & home button So So Camera & Processor
customer_reviews.author: Murali Krishna

customer_reviews.title: All I want in a phone
customer_reviews.text: For someone who doesn't have any heavy apps, mostly just run of the mill stuff like WhatsApp, Maps, etc. this phone is a dream. It's maybe a bit too big for my personal taste but it's still way smaller than most modern phones. I'm also pretty hard on it, dropping it regularly and it's stood up to my abuse. The fingerprint reader is really bang on as well, it rarely misses recognition and it's very quickly. If it broke today I imagine I wouldn't find a better phone for me.
customer_reviews.author: Matt H.

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this unit. I have had it several months and it works perfectly. Good value. The memory could be a problem if you load up 100's of apps, but I am a moderate user.
customer_reviews.author: Pe9298

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking phone but very very slow
customer_reviews.text: Have had this phone for about 18 months and for the past 10 of those months is has been running very slow, sometimes unworkably so. Very few Apps installed to use up processing power, but can't get it to speed up. Only buy it if your not in a hurry when using it ...
customer_reviews.author: James Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Bargain value for money
customer_reviews.text: Brought this as an easy cheap phone for my elderly parents as a 1st smart phone ( they wanted to video call the grandkids) was very impressed with this phone, quick enough for what we need and tbh the plastic body really doesn't bother me at all. So in a nutshell it's no way a flagship phone but if you don't care about the latest and fastest phone on the market then it's very good.
customer_reviews.author: Coffeeholic

customer_reviews.title: Best yet.
customer_reviews.text: Being my 3rd Moto G phone, I'm very impressed with this new 4th Generation Plus. It looks fabulous and is fast and responsive. I've not tried the camera yet, but all the reviews indicate I'll be very impressed with the results. OK it's bigger than the previous Moto G's but that suits me. All in all I think it's a great improvement on previous models.
customer_reviews.author: Benny

customer_reviews.title: Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent phone, feels like it should cost 2-3 times the price, amazing value for money, all functionality you need, brilliant budget phone. I already dropped it on some rock hard pebbles, face down, survived with a few scratches so seems robust as well. Buy it!
customer_reviews.author: MilanoG
